p: Among all the HIV-uninfected women, 18 of the 43 (41.9%) RSV cases were identified from visits occurring during pregnancy and the remainder occurred in the postpartum period. The incidence of RSV (per 1000 person-months) during the RSV season was higher among the 2012 cohort compared with the 2011 cohort overall (4.3 vs 1.9, respectively; IRR, 2.3 [95% CI, 1.1–4.8]) and during pregnancy (5.3 vs 1.7, respectively; IRR, 3.2 [95% CI, 1.0–9.7]) ( Table 2).
